dublinCore.dc:title: 119 S936 IS: Woke Endowment Security Tax Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Cotton introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to apply a 6 percent excise tax on large endowments of certain private colleges and universities, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Woke Endowment Security Tax Act of 2025 or the WEST Act of 2025.

section.header: Excise tax on certain large private college and university endowments

subsection.text: Subchapter H of chapter 42 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

section.header: Excise tax on certain large private college and university endowments

subsection.text: There is hereby imposed on each specified applicable educational institution for the institution's first taxable year beginning in 2025 a tax equal to 6 percent of the aggregate fair market value of the assets of the institution at the end of the preceding taxable year.
For purposes of this subchapter, with respect to a taxable year, the term specified applicable educational institution means—

paragraph.text: any applicable educational institution, other than an institution which is religious in nature, the aggregate fair market value of the assets of which at the end of the preceding taxable year (other than those assets which are used directly in carrying out the institution's exempt purpose) is at least $11,900,000,000, and

subparagraph.text: which operates a college on behalf of a State pursuant to State statute or contractual agreements, and

the aggregate fair market value of the assets of which at the end of the preceding taxable year (other than those assets which are used directly in carrying out the institution's exempt purpose) is at least $10,500,000,000.

paragraph.text: The rules of section 4968(d) shall apply.
The rules of section 4968(b)(2) shall apply.

subsection.text: The table of sections for subchapter H of chapter 42 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 4969. Excise tax on certain large private college and university endowments.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2024.
